intro: Hieracium thracicum, commonly known as the Thrace hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has basal leaves that are rough and hairy, with a rosette structure, and produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Hieracium thracicum is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain grassland ecosystems.
